overview: Krystal Biotech is focused on developing and commercializing gene therapies for dermatological diseases. They leverage their proprietary gene delivery platform for the treatment of skin diseases. Recently, they halted a phase 2 study of an engineered herpes virus therapy for skin cancer.

phase_2_failed.title: Phase 2 study of KB707 for skin cancer
phase_2_failed.why_stopped: Enrollment halted, specific reasons not disclosed

decision_makers.name: Suma Krishnan
decision_makers.role: Founder & President at Krystal Biotech, Inc.

reason_for_fit_score: Krystal Biotech's discontinuation of a phase 2 trial for a gene therapy in oncology due to undisclosed reasons, combined with their focus on dermatology and gene therapy, presents a potential opportunity for Convexia to explore rescue strategies, particularly if the failure was due to execution challenges rather than fundamental flaws in the science.
